title.narrative: QUALITY EVIDENCE

description.narrative: By 2020, relevant line ministries, TUIK, NHRI and CSOs have increased capacity to generate and use quality and disaggregated evidence on the situation of children for monitoring, reporting and advocacy purposes., which contributes to Building Capacity For Evaluation, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Evaluation And Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020 CRM systems use solid evidence for policy-making, reporting and advocacy on child rights, and facilitate claiming and redress procedures for the CRs violated.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, relevant line ministries, TUIK, NHRI and CSOs have increased capacity to generate and use quality and disaggregatedevidence on the situation of children for monitoring, reporting and advocacy purposes.

description.narrative: In collaboration with relevant government institutions and CSOs, efforts to collect, analyse and disseminate national survey and administrative data on children continued and were expanded to generate evidence on the situation of children in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic and national confinement measures. New partnerships were initiated to strengthen data dissemination and promotion of ethical norms and standards in evidence generation involving children. | Status:Met | As-of Date:17/01/2021

title.narrative: % of evaluations planned for completion in 2019 finalized (63903), Percent

Level of capacity (availability of tools, expertize, internal policies, information) of relevant CSOs and institutions to generate evidence on the situation of children in line with international good practices(44454), Text

baseline.value: Availability of tools, expertize, policies and information limited especially among national CSOs

target.value: 2020:By 2020, set of tools, expertize, information and internal policies available to/adopted by relevant CSOs and institutions

actual.value: 2020:19 NGOs + the Education Sector Group for Syria response (51 NGOs) equipped with standardized remote data collection tools to monitor the situatoin of their beneficiary children during COVID-19 Four NGOs were trained and equiped to measure child wellbeing

title.narrative: Management response to the Country Programme Evaluation completed and implemented as per plan(67763)

baseline.value: Evaluation report at finalization stage, will be used to prepare the management response

actual.value: 2020:Management responses for all TCO evaluations are finalised and being implemented as planned
